intro: Mesua nagana, commonly known as the flame of the forest, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. The plant has simple, alternate, ovate leaves that are dark green and glossy. Its bark is smooth and light brown, often exuding a milky sap when cut. Mesua nagana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
